relation: Downtown is near, and each month there is an artwalk - local artists display their work in businesses downtown.
The university is very close to downtown and there are many great restaurants around. The campus also has plenty of food places to choose from.
The dorms are expensive and quite restrictive.
Some of the professors are really great and respectable... Others are a little behind in their field.
This is not a big school; it will be easy to find and make friends here.

This university is great for students seeking a mixture between a small town and a big city. The accommodations on campus are great; modern buildings and resources are everywhere. I have really enjoyed my experience here.
pageTitle: Missouri State University-Springfield Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {357918=Id checks at dorms after 7:00 pm, and now a bluw light policy where you can push a button at any blue light stop and a cop will escort you to your destination in you are out at odd hours, or feel unsafe., 150634=My tip for prospective students is to apply early. There are a limited amount of scholarships available early on that you can receive if you apply before January of the year you plan to attend., 649479=Beautiful campus, super excited to move back in June., 325917=The greek life is expanding in the fall of 2013 there will be 7 national sororities and 1 local sorority and there are 15 national fraternities. The community is getting unusually strict though and is no longer allowed to be called Greek there., 164301=The clubs abound here at MSU. If there isn't a club that you wish to join, and you and four of your friends have an idea for a club, you can just march on down to the Office of Student Engagement and start your own club! We have everything from Academic clubs, to Spectrum, the LGBTQ club. There are tons of activities like trips and exercise classes, and we're even finishing up our recreation center which will house a pool, a rock wall, and I even hear a zip line is involved!, 169519=Apply soon! Many of the school scholarships are awarded by December. Be prepared to get involved, on campus and in the community. We're a Public Affairs University, so community service is a must for most, and campus life is purely a blast. You make friends through joining clubs and organizations, and we have a lot of them. Find your niche and jump right in!, 663875=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Come check out the campus and see if it is a place you can call home for awhile. Bang for the buck I am receiving the education I need for the future. The campus has a tram we can ride to downtown which saves gas money. Am enjoying being here There are lots of things to do on campus and around town. Am learning a lot I have learned a lot about my physical body and nutrition in our PE Class and about the world economy in my Economics class. Textiles has been interesting to see the different kinds of material that clothes can be made from. Art has been a learning process with the different mediums we used this sememster. Login to rate or flag the reviews Robert from Hollister, MO 01/04/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 13 out of 13 people found this review useful. 3 of 160
